title: Little Mix’s ‘Wings’ Goes K-Pop With New Version: Listen – Billboard
text:
A K-pop version of Little Mix's Billboard Hot 100 hit "Wings" landed on South Korean online music retailer Melon on Monday. By
												

	Jeff Benjamin Little Mix go K-pop?! Apparently so! On Monday, a Korean version of Little Mix’s Billboard Hot 100 hit (and UK No. 1 single) “Wings” surfaced on South Korean online music retailer Melon. Like many K-pop songs, the verses are sung mostly in Korean with English words peppered in. The original English chorus remains.  Explore		
	





		Explore	




















See latest videos, charts and news



See latest videos, charts and news See latest videos, charts and news See latest videos, charts and news While many K-pop acts have tested the Western pop market’s waters with English singles (such as BoA, Rain, Wonder Girls, BIGBANG, Girls’ Generation, 2NE1, miss A), rarely is the inverse seen with a Western act going Korean.  With a colorful image and hugely supportive fanbase, Little Mix isn’t too far a stretch from other K-pop girl groups — perhaps a more R&B-leaning SISTAR? Related		
	

















	
	
		
					BTS' V Drops Two Very Different Remixes of 'Slow Dancing' Solo Single		
	



	08/19/2013 Whoever they may emulate, the inspiration may have come from South Korean reality singing competition “K-Pop Star,” where a competing girl group quartet covered “Wings” on the show’s second season this January. Watch the cover — that delighted the judges — below:  At press time, representatives for Little Mix had not responded to K-Town‘s request for comment.
